data.name: Home_About_Body
data.value:
Grodno (Hrodna) is a city of old churches, medieval castles and royal palaces. It’s ancient history bagan with the Castle Hill. High on a hill, at the mouth of the river Neman and Gorodnichanka in X-XI centuries the fortified settlement was built. In 1127 the city was first mentioned in written sources.

Due to its history, this city took an unusual place in deciding the destiny of the major European nations. The Grand Duchy of Lithuania was starting off here in XIII century. At the end of the XVIII century in Grodno New Castle underwent a second partition, and later once powerful Rzeczpospolita ceased to exist.

Here one can climb to the Castle Hill, from which the whole old city is visible, visit the oldest Belarusian church – the Borisoglebskaya or Kolozhskaya (XII century), The Cathedral Catholic Church, where the Pope can lead the mass due to its status. Next to the Catholic Church and the Orthodox Church are the Lutheran Church and the Jewish Synagogueа. It gives pleasure to walk the streets of old city, where Stefan Batory and Stanislaw Poniatowski, Anthony and Jean Tizengauz Zhiliber, Czeslaw Niemen and Eliza Orzeszkowa, Bogdanovich and Vasil Bykov walked …

Grodno today is also rich with talents. To learn more about Grodno and its citizens, the Regional Studies Electronic Library (RSEL) "Grodno - information for everyone" is established.

The main aim of RSEL is collecting, preserving, and providing updated for use multidimensional, polythematic local history information.

RSEL "Grodno - information for everyone" is a repository of electronic documents in various formats that are related to the city of Grodno (Belarus). This is a database with a factual, bibliographic, graphic, sound, full-text material and the ability to refine your search in it.

The vast majority of materials is being prepared by library staff. The electronic library is organized according to the requirements of the Law "On Copyright and Related Rights" (Articles 36 and 37). The publications of certain authors are in the library with their permission. Documents, photos, videos, manuscripts submitted for publication e-library by the authors, personae themselves or members of their families from the personal archives. Text articles taken from magazines, newspapers, anthologies have bibliographical references and descriptions of the primary sources of publication.

data.name: Home_Index_FifthSlide_Title
data.value: The Polish king Stanislaw August Poniatowski lived in Grodno for two years upon detention by the order of Catherine II. In 1795, in New Castle, he signed the act of abdication, stopping 200 - year existence of the Commonwealth.

data.name: Home_Index_FirstSlide_Title
data.value: Grodno is a unique town in Belarus with outstanding architectural monuments of the past: Kalozha Church; Farny, Bridgettine and Franciscan catholic churches and monasteries and the Church of Saint Mother of God.

data.name: Home_Index_FourthSlide_Title
data.value: Under the rule of thegreat Lithuanian Duke Vytautas andthe Kings of Poland Stefan and Stanislaw Poniatowski Grodno was the residence of the monarch, and in fact has been equal to such capitals as Vilnius and Warsaw.

data.name: Home_Index_SecondSlide_Body
data.value: Крестоносцы, когда ходили на Гродненщину, нередко говорили: «Идем на пущу».

data.name: Home_Index_SecondSlide_Title
data.value: A deer on the emblem of Grodno is associated with the main occupation of townspeople – hunting. Crusaders, when they were conducting campaigns to Grodno region, often said: “We are going to the forest”.

data.name: Home_Index_SeventhSlide_Title
data.value: With the efforts of the French physician and biologist Zh.E.Zhiliber obstetric and Veterinary School, Clinical Hospital and the Botanical Garden of the two thousand plants were established in Grodno in the second half of the XVIII century.

data.name: Home_Index_SixthSlide_Title
data.value: The period of prosperity in Grodno in the second half of the XVIII century is associated with the name of Anthony Tizengauz, the mayor of the city. Weaving, manufacture of bed linen, furniture, glass, tobacco, metals, leather goods and weapons were developing.

data.name: Home_Index_ThirdSlide_Title
data.value: The past of Grodno goes into the haze of centuries. Grodno was mentioned in the chronicles in the first third of the XII century, earlier than Eastern European capitals Moscow and Vilnius.

data.name: Search_Documents_Not_Fount
data.value: Documents satisfying the search not found
